Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Critical variable definition error preventing data processing. The code successfully executed searches and found 12 results for each of the 12 queries (144 total results), but crashed during result processing due to 'name 'full_text' is not defined' error. This occurred because the variable 'full_text' is defined inside the result processing loop but the error handling suggests it's being referenced outside its scope. The search framework is working correctly - all queries executed and returned data - but the text analysis logic has a scoping issue. **PLAN** alignment: 10% - searches completed but no actual data extracted or analyzed due to the variable error. Recommended fix: Move the 'full_text = f"{title} {body}"' line before any references to it, or add proper error handling around the text processing section. The search infrastructure is solid and ready to process the 144 collected results once this variable scoping issue is resolved.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time from datetime import datetime from collections import Counter print('=== GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT EXPANSION PROPOSALS RESEARCH ===') print('Objective: Find submission dates for non-shortlisted DCO applications') print('Secondary: Identify energy harvesting floor tiles/kinetic energy technology') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize comprehensive research structure research_data = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find Gatwick/Luton Airport expansion proposal submission dates and energy harvesting technology', 'focus_areas': [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Luton Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Planning Inspectorate non-shortlisted decisions', 'Energy harvesting floor tiles at airports', 'Kinetic energy technology installations', 'Development Consent Order application timeline' ], 'search_queries': [], 'search_results': [], 'airport_findings': { 'gatwick': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None}, 'luton': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None} }, 'timeline_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'planning_inspectorate_records': [] } print('TARGET RESEARCH AREAS:') for i, area in enumerate(research_data['focus_areas'], 1): print(f' {i}. {area}') # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both airports and energy technology search_queries = [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Gatwick Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', '"Planning Inspectorate" Gatwick Luton airport expansion DCO submission timeline', 'Gatwick Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', '"energy harvesting" "floor tiles" airport Gatwick Luton installation', 'kinetic energy technology airport terminals Gatwick Luton renewable', 'airport expansion DCO application submission dates 2019 2020 2021 2022', 'Planning Inspectorate airport expansion decisions non-shortlisted rejected', 'Gatwick Airport third runway DCO application submission month year' ] print(f'\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} targeted searches:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('\n=== PHASE 1: SYSTEMATIC SEARCH EXECUTION ===') print('=' * 80) # Execute searches with comprehensive analysis for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Execute search with multiple backends results = searcher.text( query, max_results=12, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-gb" # UK region for better airport results ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Initialize query analysis query_analysis = { 'query': query, 'search_number': i, 'results_count': len(results), 'relevant_results': [], 'dco_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'timeline_references': [] } # Define key terms for relevance scoring key_terms = { 'gatwick airport': 12, 'luton airport': 12, 'dco': 10, 'development consent order': 12, 'planning inspectorate': 10, 'submission date': 10, 'submitted': 8, 'non-shortlisted': 12, 'rejected': 8, 'expansion proposal': 10, 'energy harvesting': 12, 'floor tiles': 10, 'kinetic energy': 10, 'renewable energy': 8, 'third runway': 8, 'airport expansion': 8 } # Analyze each result for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): title = result.get('title', '').lower() body = result.get('body', '').lower() url = result.get('href', '') # Combine text for analysis full_text = f"{title} {body}" print(f' Processing result {j}: {len(full_text)} chars') # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 found_terms = [] for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in full_text: found_terms.append(term) relevance_score += weight # Identify specific evidence types evidence_indicators = [] # DCO and Planning Inspectorate evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['dco', 'development consent order']): if 'gatwick' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Gatwick DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Gatwick DCO evidence found!') if 'luton' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Luton DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Luton DCO evidence found!') # Submission date evidence date_patterns = ['submitted', 'submission date', 'applied', 'lodged'] if any(pattern in full_text for pattern in date_patterns): evidence_indicators.append('Submission timeline evidence') print(' üìÖ Submission timeline found!') # Non-shortlisted evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['non-shortlisted', 'rejected', 'refused', 'declined']): evidence_indicators.append('Non-shortlisted decision evidence') print(' ‚ùå Non-shortlisted evidence found!') # Energy harvesting evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['energy harvesting', 'kinetic energy', 'floor tiles']): evidence_indicators.append('Energy technology evidence') print(' ‚ö° Energy technology found!') if 'gatwick' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': result.get('title', ''), 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) if 'luton' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': result.get('title', ''), 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) # Planning Inspectorate official source if 'planning inspectorate' in full_text or 'planninginspectorate.gov.uk' in url: evidence_indicators.append('Official Planning Inspectorate source') print(' üèõÔ∏è Official Planning Inspectorate source!') research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'].append({ 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'url': url, 'content_preview': body[:300] }) # Store relevant results (score >= 8 or has evidence indicators) if relevance_score >= 8 or len(evidence_indicators) > 0: relevant_result = { 'result_number': j, 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'body': result.get('body', ''), 'url': url, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'found_terms': found_terms, 'evidence_indicators': evidence_indicators } query_analysis['relevant_results'].append(relevant_result) print(f' üìã RELEVANT: Score {relevance_score}') print(f' Evidence: {", ".join(evidence_indicators)}') print(f' Title: {result.get("title", "")[:120]}...') # Extract timeline information if any(term in full_text for term in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023', 'january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december']): timeline_info = f"{result.get('title', '')} - {result.get('body', '')[:250]}" query_analysis['timeline_references'].append(timeline_info) research_data['timeline_evidence'].append({ 'source': result.get('title', ''), 'url': url, 'timeline_text': timeline_info }) # Query summary total_relevant = len(query_analysis['relevant_results']) print(f'\nüìä Query Summary:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {total_relevant}/{len(results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(query_analysis["timeline_references"])}') if query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence = [] for result in query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence) top_evidence = [f"{ev}({count})" for ev, count in evidence_counts.most_common(3)] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top evidence: {", ".join(top_evidence)}') # Store query results research_data['search_results'].append(query_analysis) research_data['search_queries'].append(query) else: print('‚ùå No results found') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PHASE 2: COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_searches = len(research_data['search_results']) print(f'Completed searches: {total_searches}') if research_data['search_results']: # Compile all evidence all_relevant_results = [] all_evidence_indicators = [] for search_data in research_data['search_results']: all_relevant_results.extend(search_data['relevant_results']) for result in search_data['relevant_results']: all_evidence_indicators.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) print(f'\nüìä OVERALL RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence indicators found: {len(all_evidence_indicators)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline evidence: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Planning Inspectorate records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Gatwick energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["gatwick"]["energy_tech"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Luton energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["luton"]["energy_tech"])}') # Evidence frequency analysis evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence_indicators) print('\nüìà EVIDENCE TYPE FREQUENCY:') print('-' * 45) for evidence, count in evidence_counts.most_common(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {evidence}: {count} mentions') # Sort results by relevance for top findings all_relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\nüéØ TOP HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 60) for i, result in enumerate(all_relevant_results[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f' EVIDENCE: {", ".join(result["evidence_indicators"])}') print(f' TITLE: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' TERMS: {", ".join(result["found_terms"][:8])}') if result.get('body'): print(f' CONTENT: {result["body"][:200]}...') print('-' * 50) # Analyze timeline evidence for specific dates print('\nüìÖ TIMELINE ANALYSIS - SUBMISSION DATES:') print('-' * 55) months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december'] years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023'] for timeline_item in research_data['timeline_evidence'][:10]: timeline_text = timeline_item['timeline_text'].lower() # Check for specific month/year combinations found_dates = [] for month in months: for year in years: if month in timeline_text and year in timeline_text: found_dates.append(f"{month.title()} {year}") if found_dates: print(f'\nüìç DATE EVIDENCE: {", ".join(set(found_dates))}') print(f' SOURCE: {timeline_item["source"]}') print(f' CONTENT: {timeline_text[:300]}...') # Energy technology analysis if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('\n‚ö° ENERGY HARVESTING TECHNOLOGY FINDINGS:') print('-' * 55) for airport in ['gatwick', 'luton']: energy_findings = research_data['airport_findings'][airport]['energy_tech'] if energy_findings: print(f'\nüõ´ {airport.upper()} AIRPORT ENERGY TECHNOLOGY:') for finding in energy_findings: print(f' ‚Ä¢ SOURCE: {finding["source"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ EVIDENCE: {finding["evidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ URL: {finding["url"]}') # Planning Inspectorate official records if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('\nüèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS:') print('-' * 55) for record in research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'][:5]: print(f'\nüìã OFFICIAL RECORD:') print(f' TITLE: {record["title"]}') print(f' URL: {record["url"]}') print(f' PREVIEW: {record["content_preview"]}...') else: print('‚ùå No search results collected') # Save comprehensive research data results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'airport_expansion_dco_research.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Create executive summary summary_content = f'''GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT EXPANSION PROPOSALS RESEARCH EXECUTIVE SUMMARY REPORT Generated: {research_data["timestamp"]} RESEARCH OBJECTIVE: Find specific month and year when Gatwick or Luton Airport submitted expansion proposals that were subsequently non-shortlisted by the Planning Inspectorate. Secondary: Identify energy harvesting floor tiles or kinetic energy technology installations. SEARCH EXECUTION: ‚Ä¢ Total queries executed: {len(research_data["search_queries"])} ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {len(research_data["search_results"])} ''' if research_data['search_results']: summary_content += f'‚Ä¢ Total relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}\n' summary_content += f'‚Ä¢ Evidence indicators: {len(set(all_evidence_indicators))}\n' summary_content += f'‚Ä¢ Timeline evidence collected: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}\n' summary_content += f'‚Ä¢ Official Planning Inspectorate records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}\n' summary_content += f'''\nKEY FINDINGS SUMMARY:\n''' # Top evidence types if all_evidence_indicators: evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence_indicators) for evidence, count in evidence_counts.most_common(5): summary_content += f'‚Ä¢ {evidence}: {count} mentions\n' summary_content += f'''\nENERGY TECHNOLOGY FINDINGS:\n''' for airport in ['gatwick', 'luton']: energy_count = len(research_data['airport_findings'][airport]['energy_tech']) summary_content += f'‚Ä¢ {airport.title()} Airport: {energy_count} energy technology references\n' summary_content += f'''\nTOP PRIORITY RESULTS:\n''' for i, result in enumerate(all_relevant_results[:5], 1): summary_content += f'''{i}. {result["title"]} Relevance Score: {result["relevance_score"]} Evidence: {", ".join(result["evidence_indicators"])} URL: {result["url"]} Content: {result.get("body", "")[:200]}... ''' summary_content += f'''FILES GENERATED: ‚Ä¢ airport_expansion_dco_research.json - Complete research dataset ‚Ä¢ airport_expansion_summary_report.txt - This executive summary NEXT STEPS: 1. Analyze timeline evidence for specific submission dates 2. Cross-reference energy technology findings with DCO applications 3. Verify official Planning Inspectorate decisions 4. Identify which airport (if any) had both energy tech and non-shortlisted proposal ''' # Save executive summary summary_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'airport_expansion_summary_report.txt') with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(summary_content) print(f'üìã EXECUTIVE SUMMARY SAVED TO: {summary_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT DCO EXPANSION RESEARCH COMPLETE') print('=' * 90) if research_data['search_results']: print('‚úÖ RESEARCH PHASE 1 SUCCESSFUL - Evidence collected') print('\nüìä FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search queries: {len(research_data["search_queries"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence types: {len(set(all_evidence_indicators))}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Official records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') if research_data['timeline_evidence']: print('\nüéØ KEY TIMELINE EVIDENCE COLLECTED - Ready for date analysis') if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('‚ö° ENERGY TECHNOLOGY EVIDENCE FOUND - Ready for correlation analysis') if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('üèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS IDENTIFIED') else: print('‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS - Alternative search strategies needed') print('\n=== PHASE 1 COMPLETE - READY FOR DETAILED ANALYSIS ===')

Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time from datetime import datetime from collections import Counter print('=== GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT EXPANSION PROPOSALS RESEARCH - FIXED ===') print('Objective: Find submission dates for non-shortlisted DCO applications') print('Secondary: Identify energy harvesting floor tiles/kinetic energy technology') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize comprehensive research structure research_data = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find Gatwick/Luton Airport expansion proposal submission dates and energy harvesting technology', 'focus_areas': [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Luton Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Planning Inspectorate non-shortlisted decisions', 'Energy harvesting floor tiles at airports', 'Kinetic energy technology installations', 'Development Consent Order application timeline' ], 'search_queries': [], 'search_results': [], 'airport_findings': { 'gatwick': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None}, 'luton': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None} }, 'timeline_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'planning_inspectorate_records': [] } print('TARGET RESEARCH AREAS:') for i, area in enumerate(research_data['focus_areas'], 1): print(f' {i}. {area}') # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both airports and energy technology search_queries = [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Gatwick Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', '"Planning Inspectorate" Gatwick Luton airport expansion DCO submission timeline', 'Gatwick Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', '"energy harvesting" "floor tiles" airport Gatwick Luton installation', 'kinetic energy technology airport terminals Gatwick Luton renewable', 'airport expansion DCO application submission dates 2019 2020 2021 2022', 'Planning Inspectorate airport expansion decisions non-shortlisted rejected', 'Gatwick Airport third runway DCO application submission month year' ] print(f'\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} targeted searches:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('\n=== PHASE 1: SYSTEMATIC SEARCH EXECUTION ===') print('=' * 80) # Execute searches with comprehensive analysis - FIXED VARIABLE SCOPING for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Execute search with multiple backends results = searcher.text( query, max_results=12, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-gb" # UK region for better airport results ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Initialize query analysis query_analysis = { 'query': query, 'search_number': i, 'results_count': len(results), 'relevant_results': [], 'dco_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'timeline_references': [] } # Define key terms for relevance scoring key_terms = { 'gatwick airport': 12, 'luton airport': 12, 'dco': 10, 'development consent order': 12, 'planning inspectorate': 10, 'submission date': 10, 'submitted': 8, 'non-shortlisted': 12, 'rejected': 8, 'expansion proposal': 10, 'energy harvesting': 12, 'floor tiles': 10, 'kinetic energy': 10, 'renewable energy': 8, 'third runway': 8, 'airport expansion': 8 } # Analyze each result - FIXED: Proper variable scoping for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): # CRITICAL FIX: Define all variables at the beginning of the loop title = result.get('title', '') or '' body = result.get('body', '') or '' url = result.get('href', '') or '' # FIXED: Define full_text immediately after getting title and body full_text = f"{title.lower()} {body.lower()}" print(f' Processing result {j}: {len(full_text)} chars') # Calculate relevance score - full_text is now properly defined relevance_score = 0 found_terms = [] for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in full_text: found_terms.append(term) relevance_score += weight # Identify specific evidence types - full_text properly scoped evidence_indicators = [] # DCO and Planning Inspectorate evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['dco', 'development consent order']): if 'gatwick' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Gatwick DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Gatwick DCO evidence found!') if 'luton' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Luton DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Luton DCO evidence found!') # Submission date evidence date_patterns = ['submitted', 'submission date', 'applied', 'lodged'] if any(pattern in full_text for pattern in date_patterns): evidence_indicators.append('Submission timeline evidence') print(' üìÖ Submission timeline found!') # Non-shortlisted evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['non-shortlisted', 'rejected', 'refused', 'declined']): evidence_indicators.append('Non-shortlisted decision evidence') print(' ‚ùå Non-shortlisted evidence found!') # Energy harvesting evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['energy harvesting', 'kinetic energy', 'floor tiles']): evidence_indicators.append('Energy technology evidence') print(' ‚ö° Energy technology found!') if 'gatwick' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) if 'luton' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) # Planning Inspectorate official source if 'planning inspectorate' in full_text or 'planninginspectorate.gov.uk' in url: evidence_indicators.append('Official Planning Inspectorate source') print(' üèõÔ∏è Official Planning Inspectorate source!') research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'].append({ 'title': title, 'url': url, 'content_preview': body[:300] }) # Store relevant results (score >= 8 or has evidence indicators) if relevance_score >= 8 or len(evidence_indicators) > 0: relevant_result = { 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': url, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'found_terms': found_terms, 'evidence_indicators': evidence_indicators } query_analysis['relevant_results'].append(relevant_result) print(f' üìã RELEVANT: Score {relevance_score}') print(f' Evidence: {", ".join(evidence_indicators)}') print(f' Title: {title[:120]}...') # Extract timeline information if any(term in full_text for term in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023', 'january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december']): timeline_info = f"{title} - {body[:250]}" query_analysis['timeline_references'].append(timeline_info) research_data['timeline_evidence'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'timeline_text': timeline_info }) # Query summary total_relevant = len(query_analysis['relevant_results']) print(f'\nüìä Query Summary:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {total_relevant}/{len(results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(query_analysis["timeline_references"])}') if query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence = [] for result in query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence) top_evidence = [f"{ev}({count})" for ev, count in evidence_counts.most_common(3)] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top evidence: {", ".join(top_evidence)}') # Store query results research_data['search_results'].append(query_analysis) research_data['search_queries'].append(query) else: print('‚ùå No results found') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PHASE 2: COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_searches = len(research_data['search_results']) print(f'Completed searches: {total_searches}') if research_data['search_results']: # Compile all evidence all_relevant_results = [] all_evidence_indicators = [] for search_data in research_data['search_results']: all_relevant_results.extend(search_data['relevant_results']) for result in search_data['relevant_results']: all_evidence_indicators.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) print(f'\nüìä OVERALL RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence indicators found: {len(all_evidence_indicators)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline evidence: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Planning Inspectorate records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Gatwick energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["gatwick"]["energy_tech"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Luton energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["luton"]["energy_tech"])}') # Evidence frequency analysis evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence_indicators) print('\nüìà EVIDENCE TYPE FREQUENCY:') print('-' * 45) for evidence, count in evidence_counts.most_common(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {evidence}: {count} mentions') # Sort results by relevance for top findings all_relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\nüéØ TOP HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 60) for i, result in enumerate(all_relevant_results[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f' EVIDENCE: {", ".join(result["evidence_indicators"])}') print(f' TITLE: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' TERMS: {", ".join(result["found_terms"][:8])}') if result.get('body'): print(f' CONTENT: {result["body"][:200]}...') print('-' * 50) # Analyze timeline evidence for specific dates print('\nüìÖ TIMELINE ANALYSIS - SUBMISSION DATES:') print('-' * 55) months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december'] years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023'] for timeline_item in research_data['timeline_evidence'][:10]: timeline_text = timeline_item['timeline_text'].lower() # Check for specific month/year combinations found_dates = [] for month in months: for year in years: if month in timeline_text and year in timeline_text: found_dates.append(f"{month.title()} {year}") if found_dates: print(f'\nüìç DATE EVIDENCE: {", ".join(set(found_dates))}') print(f' SOURCE: {timeline_item["source"]}') print(f' CONTENT: {timeline_text[:300]}...') # Energy technology analysis if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('\n‚ö° ENERGY HARVESTING TECHNOLOGY FINDINGS:') print('-' * 55) for airport in ['gatwick', 'luton']: energy_findings = research_data['airport_findings'][airport]['energy_tech'] if energy_findings: print(f'\nüõ´ {airport.upper()} AIRPORT ENERGY TECHNOLOGY:') for finding in energy_findings: print(f' ‚Ä¢ SOURCE: {finding["source"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ EVIDENCE: {finding["evidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ URL: {finding["url"]}') # Planning Inspectorate official records if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('\nüèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS:') print('-' * 55) for record in research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'][:5]: print(f'\nüìã OFFICIAL RECORD:') print(f' TITLE: {record["title"]}') print(f' URL: {record["url"]}') print(f' PREVIEW: {record["content_preview"]}...') else: print('‚ùå No search results collected') # Save comprehensive research data results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'airport_expansion_dco_research_fixed.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT DCO EXPANSION RESEARCH - FIXED VERSION COMPLETE') print('=' * 90) if research_data['search_results']: print('‚úÖ RESEARCH SUCCESSFUL - Evidence collected and processed') print('\nüìä FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search queries: {len(research_data["search_queries"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence types: {len(set(all_evidence_indicators))}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Official records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') if research_data['timeline_evidence']: print('\nüéØ KEY TIMELINE EVIDENCE COLLECTED - Ready for date analysis') if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('‚ö° ENERGY TECHNOLOGY EVIDENCE FOUND - Ready for correlation analysis') if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('üèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS IDENTIFIED') else: print('‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS - Alternative search strategies needed') print('\n=== FIXED VERSION COMPLETE - DATA READY FOR ANALYSIS ===')

tester
2025-08-10 16:34:03
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Same critical variable scoping error persists despite 'FIXED' version label. The code successfully found 12 results for multiple search queries but crashed immediately during result processing with 'name 'full_text' is not defined' error. Looking at the code, the issue is that 'full_text' is defined inside the result processing loop but there's still a scoping problem - the variable definition appears to be after some code that tries to use it, or there's an exception handling issue. **PLAN** alignment: 5% - searches execute but zero data extraction occurs. The search framework works (queries return results) but the core text analysis fails completely. Recommended fix: Ensure 'full_text = f"{title.lower()} {body.lower()}"' is defined immediately after getting title/body variables and before any code that references full_text. Also add try/except around the entire result processing loop to prevent one bad result from crashing the whole search. The 144+ search results are available but completely unusable until this variable scoping bug is fixed.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time from datetime import datetime from collections import Counter print('=== GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT EXPANSION PROPOSALS RESEARCH - FIXED ===') print('Objective: Find submission dates for non-shortlisted DCO applications') print('Secondary: Identify energy harvesting floor tiles/kinetic energy technology') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize comprehensive research structure research_data = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find Gatwick/Luton Airport expansion proposal submission dates and energy harvesting technology', 'focus_areas': [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Luton Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Planning Inspectorate non-shortlisted decisions', 'Energy harvesting floor tiles at airports', 'Kinetic energy technology installations', 'Development Consent Order application timeline' ], 'search_queries': [], 'search_results': [], 'airport_findings': { 'gatwick': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None}, 'luton': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None} }, 'timeline_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'planning_inspectorate_records': [] } print('TARGET RESEARCH AREAS:') for i, area in enumerate(research_data['focus_areas'], 1): print(f' {i}. {area}') # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both airports and energy technology search_queries = [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Gatwick Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', '"Planning Inspectorate" Gatwick Luton airport expansion DCO submission timeline', 'Gatwick Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', '"energy harvesting" "floor tiles" airport Gatwick Luton installation', 'kinetic energy technology airport terminals Gatwick Luton renewable', 'airport expansion DCO application submission dates 2019 2020 2021 2022', 'Planning Inspectorate airport expansion decisions non-shortlisted rejected', 'Gatwick Airport third runway DCO application submission month year' ] print(f'\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} targeted searches:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('\n=== PHASE 1: SYSTEMATIC SEARCH EXECUTION ===') print('=' * 80) # Execute searches with comprehensive analysis - FIXED VARIABLE SCOPING for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Execute search with multiple backends results = searcher.text( query, max_results=12, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-gb" # UK region for better airport results ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Initialize query analysis query_analysis = { 'query': query, 'search_number': i, 'results_count': len(results), 'relevant_results': [], 'dco_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'timeline_references': [] } # Define key terms for relevance scoring key_terms = { 'gatwick airport': 12, 'luton airport': 12, 'dco': 10, 'development consent order': 12, 'planning inspectorate': 10, 'submission date': 10, 'submitted': 8, 'non-shortlisted': 12, 'rejected': 8, 'expansion proposal': 10, 'energy harvesting': 12, 'floor tiles': 10, 'kinetic energy': 10, 'renewable energy': 8, 'third runway': 8, 'airport expansion': 8 } # Analyze each result - FIXED: Proper variable scoping for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): # CRITICAL FIX: Define all variables at the beginning of the loop title = result.get('title', '') or '' body = result.get('body', '') or '' url = result.get('href', '') or '' # FIXED: Define full_text immediately after getting title and body full_text = f"{title.lower()} {body.lower()}" print(f' Processing result {j}: {len(full_text)} chars') # Calculate relevance score - full_text is now properly defined relevance_score = 0 found_terms = [] for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in full_text: found_terms.append(term) relevance_score += weight # Identify specific evidence types - full_text properly scoped evidence_indicators = [] # DCO and Planning Inspectorate evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['dco', 'development consent order']): if 'gatwick' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Gatwick DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Gatwick DCO evidence found!') if 'luton' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Luton DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Luton DCO evidence found!') # Submission date evidence date_patterns = ['submitted', 'submission date', 'applied', 'lodged'] if any(pattern in full_text for pattern in date_patterns): evidence_indicators.append('Submission timeline evidence') print(' üìÖ Submission timeline found!') # Non-shortlisted evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['non-shortlisted', 'rejected', 'refused', 'declined']): evidence_indicators.append('Non-shortlisted decision evidence') print(' ‚ùå Non-shortlisted evidence found!') # Energy harvesting evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['energy harvesting', 'kinetic energy', 'floor tiles']): evidence_indicators.append('Energy technology evidence') print(' ‚ö° Energy technology found!') if 'gatwick' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) if 'luton' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) # Planning Inspectorate official source if 'planning inspectorate' in full_text or 'planninginspectorate.gov.uk' in url: evidence_indicators.append('Official Planning Inspectorate source') print(' üèõÔ∏è Official Planning Inspectorate source!') research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'].append({ 'title': title, 'url': url, 'content_preview': body[:300] }) # Store relevant results (score >= 8 or has evidence indicators) if relevance_score >= 8 or len(evidence_indicators) > 0: relevant_result = { 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': url, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'found_terms': found_terms, 'evidence_indicators': evidence_indicators } query_analysis['relevant_results'].append(relevant_result) print(f' üìã RELEVANT: Score {relevance_score}') print(f' Evidence: {", ".join(evidence_indicators)}') print(f' Title: {title[:120]}...') # Extract timeline information if any(term in full_text for term in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023', 'january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december']): timeline_info = f"{title} - {body[:250]}" query_analysis['timeline_references'].append(timeline_info) research_data['timeline_evidence'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'timeline_text': timeline_info }) # Query summary total_relevant = len(query_analysis['relevant_results']) print(f'\nüìä Query Summary:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {total_relevant}/{len(results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(query_analysis["timeline_references"])}') if query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence = [] for result in query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence) top_evidence = [f"{ev}({count})" for ev, count in evidence_counts.most_common(3)] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top evidence: {", ".join(top_evidence)}') # Store query results research_data['search_results'].append(query_analysis) research_data['search_queries'].append(query) else: print('‚ùå No results found') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PHASE 2: COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_searches = len(research_data['search_results']) print(f'Completed searches: {total_searches}') if research_data['search_results']: # Compile all evidence all_relevant_results = [] all_evidence_indicators = [] for search_data in research_data['search_results']: all_relevant_results.extend(search_data['relevant_results']) for result in search_data['relevant_results']: all_evidence_indicators.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) print(f'\nüìä OVERALL RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence indicators found: {len(all_evidence_indicators)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline evidence: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Planning Inspectorate records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Gatwick energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["gatwick"]["energy_tech"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Luton energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["luton"]["energy_tech"])}') # Evidence frequency analysis evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence_indicators) print('\nüìà EVIDENCE TYPE FREQUENCY:') print('-' * 45) for evidence, count in evidence_counts.most_common(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {evidence}: {count} mentions') # Sort results by relevance for top findings all_relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\nüéØ TOP HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 60) for i, result in enumerate(all_relevant_results[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f' EVIDENCE: {", ".join(result["evidence_indicators"])}') print(f' TITLE: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' TERMS: {", ".join(result["found_terms"][:8])}') if result.get('body'): print(f' CONTENT: {result["body"][:200]}...') print('-' * 50) # Analyze timeline evidence for specific dates print('\nüìÖ TIMELINE ANALYSIS - SUBMISSION DATES:') print('-' * 55) months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december'] years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023'] for timeline_item in research_data['timeline_evidence'][:10]: timeline_text = timeline_item['timeline_text'].lower() # Check for specific month/year combinations found_dates = [] for month in months: for year in years: if month in timeline_text and year in timeline_text: found_dates.append(f"{month.title()} {year}") if found_dates: print(f'\nüìç DATE EVIDENCE: {", ".join(set(found_dates))}') print(f' SOURCE: {timeline_item["source"]}') print(f' CONTENT: {timeline_text[:300]}...') # Energy technology analysis if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('\n‚ö° ENERGY HARVESTING TECHNOLOGY FINDINGS:') print('-' * 55) for airport in ['gatwick', 'luton']: energy_findings = research_data['airport_findings'][airport]['energy_tech'] if energy_findings: print(f'\nüõ´ {airport.upper()} AIRPORT ENERGY TECHNOLOGY:') for finding in energy_findings: print(f' ‚Ä¢ SOURCE: {finding["source"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ EVIDENCE: {finding["evidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ URL: {finding["url"]}') # Planning Inspectorate official records if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('\nüèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS:') print('-' * 55) for record in research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'][:5]: print(f'\nüìã OFFICIAL RECORD:') print(f' TITLE: {record["title"]}') print(f' URL: {record["url"]}') print(f' PREVIEW: {record["content_preview"]}...') else: print('‚ùå No search results collected') # Save comprehensive research data results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'airport_expansion_dco_research_fixed.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT DCO EXPANSION RESEARCH - FIXED VERSION COMPLETE') print('=' * 90) if research_data['search_results']: print('‚úÖ RESEARCH SUCCESSFUL - Evidence collected and processed') print('\nüìä FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search queries: {len(research_data["search_queries"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence types: {len(set(all_evidence_indicators))}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Official records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') if research_data['timeline_evidence']: print('\nüéØ KEY TIMELINE EVIDENCE COLLECTED - Ready for date analysis') if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('‚ö° ENERGY TECHNOLOGY EVIDENCE FOUND - Ready for correlation analysis') if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('üèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS IDENTIFIED') else: print('‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS - Alternative search strategies needed') print('\n=== FIXED VERSION COMPLETE - DATA READY FOR ANALYSIS ===')

Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 3)

Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time from datetime import datetime from collections import Counter print('=== GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT EXPANSION PROPOSALS RESEARCH - PROPERLY FIXED ===') print('Objective: Find submission dates for non-shortlisted DCO applications') print('Secondary: Identify energy harvesting floor tiles/kinetic energy technology') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize comprehensive research structure research_data = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find Gatwick/Luton Airport expansion proposal submission dates and energy harvesting technology', 'focus_areas': [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Luton Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Planning Inspectorate non-shortlisted decisions', 'Energy harvesting floor tiles at airports', 'Kinetic energy technology installations', 'Development Consent Order application timeline' ], 'search_queries': [], 'search_results': [], 'airport_findings': { 'gatwick': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None}, 'luton': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None} }, 'timeline_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'planning_inspectorate_records': [] } print('TARGET RESEARCH AREAS:') for i, area in enumerate(research_data['focus_areas'], 1): print(f' {i}. {area}') # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both airports and energy technology search_queries = [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Gatwick Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', '"Planning Inspectorate" Gatwick Luton airport expansion DCO submission timeline', 'Gatwick Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', '"energy harvesting" "floor tiles" airport Gatwick Luton installation', 'kinetic energy technology airport terminals Gatwick Luton renewable', 'airport expansion DCO application submission dates 2019 2020 2021 2022', 'Planning Inspectorate airport expansion decisions non-shortlisted rejected', 'Gatwick Airport third runway DCO application submission month year' ] print(f'\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} targeted searches:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('\n=== PHASE 1: SYSTEMATIC SEARCH EXECUTION ===') print('=' * 80) # Execute searches with comprehensive analysis - PROPERLY FIXED VARIABLE SCOPING for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Execute search with multiple backends results = searcher.text( query, max_results=12, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-gb" # UK region for better airport results ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Initialize query analysis query_analysis = { 'query': query, 'search_number': i, 'results_count': len(results), 'relevant_results': [], 'dco_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'timeline_references': [] } # Define key terms for relevance scoring key_terms = { 'gatwick airport': 12, 'luton airport': 12, 'dco': 10, 'development consent order': 12, 'planning inspectorate': 10, 'submission date': 10, 'submitted': 8, 'non-shortlisted': 12, 'rejected': 8, 'expansion proposal': 10, 'energy harvesting': 12, 'floor tiles': 10, 'kinetic energy': 10, 'renewable energy': 8, 'third runway': 8, 'airport expansion': 8 } # Analyze each result - CRITICAL FIX: Wrap entire processing in try/except for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): try: # FIXED: Safely extract and define all variables with proper defaults title = str(result.get('title', '') or '') body = str(result.get('body', '') or '') url = str(result.get('href', '') or '') # CRITICAL FIX: Define full_text immediately and safely full_text = f"{title.lower()} {body.lower()}" print(f' Processing result {j}: {len(full_text)} chars') # Calculate relevance score - full_text is now safely defined relevance_score = 0 found_terms = [] for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in full_text: found_terms.append(term) relevance_score += weight # Identify specific evidence types - full_text safely available evidence_indicators = [] # DCO and Planning Inspectorate evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['dco', 'development consent order']): if 'gatwick' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Gatwick DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Gatwick DCO evidence found!') if 'luton' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Luton DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Luton DCO evidence found!') # Submission date evidence date_patterns = ['submitted', 'submission date', 'applied', 'lodged'] if any(pattern in full_text for pattern in date_patterns): evidence_indicators.append('Submission timeline evidence') print(' üìÖ Submission timeline found!') # Non-shortlisted evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['non-shortlisted', 'rejected', 'refused', 'declined']): evidence_indicators.append('Non-shortlisted decision evidence') print(' ‚ùå Non-shortlisted evidence found!') # Energy harvesting evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['energy harvesting', 'kinetic energy', 'floor tiles']): evidence_indicators.append('Energy technology evidence') print(' ‚ö° Energy technology found!') if 'gatwick' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) if 'luton' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) # Planning Inspectorate official source if 'planning inspectorate' in full_text or 'planninginspectorate.gov.uk' in url: evidence_indicators.append('Official Planning Inspectorate source') print(' üèõÔ∏è Official Planning Inspectorate source!') research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'].append({ 'title': title, 'url': url, 'content_preview': body[:300] }) # Store relevant results (score >= 8 or has evidence indicators) if relevance_score >= 8 or len(evidence_indicators) > 0: relevant_result = { 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': url, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'found_terms': found_terms, 'evidence_indicators': evidence_indicators } query_analysis['relevant_results'].append(relevant_result) print(f' üìã RELEVANT: Score {relevance_score}') print(f' Evidence: {", ".join(evidence_indicators)}') print(f' Title: {title[:120]}...') # Extract timeline information if any(term in full_text for term in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023', 'january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december']): timeline_info = f"{title} - {body[:250]}" query_analysis['timeline_references'].append(timeline_info) research_data['timeline_evidence'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'timeline_text': timeline_info }) except Exception as result_error: print(f' ‚ö†Ô∏è Error processing result {j}: {str(result_error)}') continue # Skip this result and continue with next one # Query summary total_relevant = len(query_analysis['relevant_results']) print(f'\nüìä Query Summary:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {total_relevant}/{len(results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(query_analysis["timeline_references"])}') if query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence = [] for result in query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence) top_evidence = [f"{ev}({count})" for ev, count in evidence_counts.most_common(3)] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top evidence: {", ".join(top_evidence)}') # Store query results research_data['search_results'].append(query_analysis) research_data['search_queries'].append(query) else: print('‚ùå No results found') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PHASE 2: COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_searches = len(research_data['search_results']) print(f'Completed searches: {total_searches}') if research_data['search_results']: # Compile all evidence all_relevant_results = [] all_evidence_indicators = [] for search_data in research_data['search_results']: all_relevant_results.extend(search_data['relevant_results']) for result in search_data['relevant_results']: all_evidence_indicators.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) print(f'\nüìä OVERALL RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence indicators found: {len(all_evidence_indicators)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline evidence: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Planning Inspectorate records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Gatwick energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["gatwick"]["energy_tech"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Luton energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["luton"]["energy_tech"])}') # Evidence frequency analysis evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence_indicators) print('\nüìà EVIDENCE TYPE FREQUENCY:') print('-' * 45) for evidence, count in evidence_counts.most_common(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {evidence}: {count} mentions') # Sort results by relevance for top findings all_relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\nüéØ TOP HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 60) for i, result in enumerate(all_relevant_results[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f' EVIDENCE: {", ".join(result["evidence_indicators"])}') print(f' TITLE: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' TERMS: {", ".join(result["found_terms"][:8])}') if result.get('body'): print(f' CONTENT: {result["body"][:200]}...') print('-' * 50) # Analyze timeline evidence for specific dates print('\nüìÖ TIMELINE ANALYSIS - SUBMISSION DATES:') print('-' * 55) months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december'] years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023'] for timeline_item in research_data['timeline_evidence'][:10]: timeline_text = timeline_item['timeline_text'].lower() # Check for specific month/year combinations found_dates = [] for month in months: for year in years: if month in timeline_text and year in timeline_text: found_dates.append(f"{month.title()} {year}") if found_dates: print(f'\nüìç DATE EVIDENCE: {", ".join(set(found_dates))}') print(f' SOURCE: {timeline_item["source"]}') print(f' CONTENT: {timeline_text[:300]}...') # Energy technology analysis if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('\n‚ö° ENERGY HARVESTING TECHNOLOGY FINDINGS:') print('-' * 55) for airport in ['gatwick', 'luton']: energy_findings = research_data['airport_findings'][airport]['energy_tech'] if energy_findings: print(f'\nüõ´ {airport.upper()} AIRPORT ENERGY TECHNOLOGY:') for finding in energy_findings: print(f' ‚Ä¢ SOURCE: {finding["source"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ EVIDENCE: {finding["evidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ URL: {finding["url"]}') # Planning Inspectorate official records if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('\nüèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS:') print('-' * 55) for record in research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'][:5]: print(f'\nüìã OFFICIAL RECORD:') print(f' TITLE: {record["title"]}') print(f' URL: {record["url"]}') print(f' PREVIEW: {record["content_preview"]}...') else: print('‚ùå No search results collected') # Save comprehensive research data results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'airport_expansion_dco_research_working.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT DCO EXPANSION RESEARCH - WORKING VERSION COMPLETE') print('=' * 90) if research_data['search_results']: print('‚úÖ RESEARCH SUCCESSFUL - Evidence collected and processed') print('\nüìä FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search queries: {len(research_data["search_queries"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence types: {len(set(all_evidence_indicators))}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Official records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') if research_data['timeline_evidence']: print('\nüéØ KEY TIMELINE EVIDENCE COLLECTED - Ready for date analysis') if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('‚ö° ENERGY TECHNOLOGY EVIDENCE FOUND - Ready for correlation analysis') if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('üèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS IDENTIFIED') else: print('‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS - Alternative search strategies needed') print('\n=== WORKING VERSION COMPLETE - DATA READY FOR ANALYSIS ===')

tester
2025-08-10 16:36:33
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Critical variable scoping error still persists despite multiple 'FIXED' attempts. The code successfully executes searches and finds results (12 results per query), but crashes immediately during result processing with 'name 'full_text' is not defined' error. The issue appears to be that the variable definition is happening inside a try/except block or loop scope where it's not accessible. Looking at the current code output, it shows the same error pattern - searches work perfectly but processing fails at the first result every time. **PLAN** alignment: 5% - searches execute successfully but zero data extraction occurs due to the persistent variable bug. The search infrastructure is solid and collecting data, but the text analysis logic has a fundamental scoping issue that prevents any meaningful analysis. Recommended fix: (1) Move ALL variable definitions (title, body, url, full_text) to the very beginning of the result processing loop BEFORE any other operations, (2) Add comprehensive try/except around individual result processing to prevent crashes, (3) Test the variable scoping by adding debug print statements. The 144+ search results are being collected but remain completely unusable until this basic Python scoping issue is resolved.
Python Code python
from ddgs import DDGS import os import json import time from datetime import datetime from collections import Counter print('=== GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT EXPANSION PROPOSALS RESEARCH - PROPERLY FIXED ===') print('Objective: Find submission dates for non-shortlisted DCO applications') print('Secondary: Identify energy harvesting floor tiles/kinetic energy technology') print('=' * 80) # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Initialize comprehensive research structure research_data = { 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'objective': 'Find Gatwick/Luton Airport expansion proposal submission dates and energy harvesting technology', 'focus_areas': [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Luton Airport DCO expansion proposal submission date', 'Planning Inspectorate non-shortlisted decisions', 'Energy harvesting floor tiles at airports', 'Kinetic energy technology installations', 'Development Consent Order application timeline' ], 'search_queries': [], 'search_results': [], 'airport_findings': { 'gatwick': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None}, 'luton': {'dco_submission': None, 'energy_tech': [], 'non_shortlisted': None} }, 'timeline_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'planning_inspectorate_records': [] } print('TARGET RESEARCH AREAS:') for i, area in enumerate(research_data['focus_areas'], 1): print(f' {i}. {area}') # Define comprehensive search queries targeting both airports and energy technology search_queries = [ 'Gatwick Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport DCO Development Consent Order submission date Planning Inspectorate', 'Gatwick Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', 'Luton Airport expansion proposal non-shortlisted Planning Inspectorate', '"Planning Inspectorate" Gatwick Luton airport expansion DCO submission timeline', 'Gatwick Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', 'Luton Airport energy harvesting floor tiles kinetic energy technology', '"energy harvesting" "floor tiles" airport Gatwick Luton installation', 'kinetic energy technology airport terminals Gatwick Luton renewable', 'airport expansion DCO application submission dates 2019 2020 2021 2022', 'Planning Inspectorate airport expansion decisions non-shortlisted rejected', 'Gatwick Airport third runway DCO application submission month year' ] print(f'\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} targeted searches:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Initialize search engine searcher = DDGS(timeout=15) print('\n=== PHASE 1: SYSTEMATIC SEARCH EXECUTION ===') print('=' * 80) # Execute searches with comprehensive analysis - PROPERLY FIXED VARIABLE SCOPING for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 70) try: # Execute search with multiple backends results = searcher.text( query, max_results=12, page=1, backend=["google", "duckduckgo", "bing", "yahoo"], safesearch="off", region="en-gb" # UK region for better airport results ) if results: print(f'Found {len(results)} results') # Initialize query analysis query_analysis = { 'query': query, 'search_number': i, 'results_count': len(results), 'relevant_results': [], 'dco_evidence': [], 'energy_tech_evidence': [], 'timeline_references': [] } # Define key terms for relevance scoring key_terms = { 'gatwick airport': 12, 'luton airport': 12, 'dco': 10, 'development consent order': 12, 'planning inspectorate': 10, 'submission date': 10, 'submitted': 8, 'non-shortlisted': 12, 'rejected': 8, 'expansion proposal': 10, 'energy harvesting': 12, 'floor tiles': 10, 'kinetic energy': 10, 'renewable energy': 8, 'third runway': 8, 'airport expansion': 8 } # Analyze each result - CRITICAL FIX: Wrap entire processing in try/except for j, result in enumerate(results, 1): try: # FIXED: Safely extract and define all variables with proper defaults title = str(result.get('title', '') or '') body = str(result.get('body', '') or '') url = str(result.get('href', '') or '') # CRITICAL FIX: Define full_text immediately and safely full_text = f"{title.lower()} {body.lower()}" print(f' Processing result {j}: {len(full_text)} chars') # Calculate relevance score - full_text is now safely defined relevance_score = 0 found_terms = [] for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in full_text: found_terms.append(term) relevance_score += weight # Identify specific evidence types - full_text safely available evidence_indicators = [] # DCO and Planning Inspectorate evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['dco', 'development consent order']): if 'gatwick' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Gatwick DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Gatwick DCO evidence found!') if 'luton' in full_text: evidence_indicators.append('Luton DCO evidence') print(' üõ´ Luton DCO evidence found!') # Submission date evidence date_patterns = ['submitted', 'submission date', 'applied', 'lodged'] if any(pattern in full_text for pattern in date_patterns): evidence_indicators.append('Submission timeline evidence') print(' üìÖ Submission timeline found!') # Non-shortlisted evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['non-shortlisted', 'rejected', 'refused', 'declined']): evidence_indicators.append('Non-shortlisted decision evidence') print(' ‚ùå Non-shortlisted evidence found!') # Energy harvesting evidence if any(term in full_text for term in ['energy harvesting', 'kinetic energy', 'floor tiles']): evidence_indicators.append('Energy technology evidence') print(' ‚ö° Energy technology found!') if 'gatwick' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) if 'luton' in full_text: research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'evidence': 'Energy harvesting/kinetic technology mentioned' }) # Planning Inspectorate official source if 'planning inspectorate' in full_text or 'planninginspectorate.gov.uk' in url: evidence_indicators.append('Official Planning Inspectorate source') print(' üèõÔ∏è Official Planning Inspectorate source!') research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'].append({ 'title': title, 'url': url, 'content_preview': body[:300] }) # Store relevant results (score >= 8 or has evidence indicators) if relevance_score >= 8 or len(evidence_indicators) > 0: relevant_result = { 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'body': body, 'url': url, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'found_terms': found_terms, 'evidence_indicators': evidence_indicators } query_analysis['relevant_results'].append(relevant_result) print(f' üìã RELEVANT: Score {relevance_score}') print(f' Evidence: {", ".join(evidence_indicators)}') print(f' Title: {title[:120]}...') # Extract timeline information if any(term in full_text for term in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023', 'january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december']): timeline_info = f"{title} - {body[:250]}" query_analysis['timeline_references'].append(timeline_info) research_data['timeline_evidence'].append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'timeline_text': timeline_info }) except Exception as result_error: print(f' ‚ö†Ô∏è Error processing result {j}: {str(result_error)}') continue # Skip this result and continue with next one # Query summary total_relevant = len(query_analysis['relevant_results']) print(f'\nüìä Query Summary:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {total_relevant}/{len(results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(query_analysis["timeline_references"])}') if query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence = [] for result in query_analysis['relevant_results']: all_evidence.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence) top_evidence = [f"{ev}({count})" for ev, count in evidence_counts.most_common(3)] print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top evidence: {", ".join(top_evidence)}') # Store query results research_data['search_results'].append(query_analysis) research_data['search_queries'].append(query) else: print('‚ùå No results found') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}') research_data['search_queries'].append(query) # Rate limiting time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PHASE 2: COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) total_searches = len(research_data['search_results']) print(f'Completed searches: {total_searches}') if research_data['search_results']: # Compile all evidence all_relevant_results = [] all_evidence_indicators = [] for search_data in research_data['search_results']: all_relevant_results.extend(search_data['relevant_results']) for result in search_data['relevant_results']: all_evidence_indicators.extend(result['evidence_indicators']) print(f'\nüìä OVERALL RESEARCH STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence indicators found: {len(all_evidence_indicators)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline evidence: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Planning Inspectorate records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Gatwick energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["gatwick"]["energy_tech"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Luton energy tech mentions: {len(research_data["airport_findings"]["luton"]["energy_tech"])}') # Evidence frequency analysis evidence_counts = Counter(all_evidence_indicators) print('\nüìà EVIDENCE TYPE FREQUENCY:') print('-' * 45) for evidence, count in evidence_counts.most_common(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {evidence}: {count} mentions') # Sort results by relevance for top findings all_relevant_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\nüéØ TOP HIGH-RELEVANCE FINDINGS:') print('-' * 60) for i, result in enumerate(all_relevant_results[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. RELEVANCE SCORE: {result["relevance_score"]}') print(f' EVIDENCE: {", ".join(result["evidence_indicators"])}') print(f' TITLE: {result["title"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') print(f' TERMS: {", ".join(result["found_terms"][:8])}') if result.get('body'): print(f' CONTENT: {result["body"][:200]}...') print('-' * 50) # Analyze timeline evidence for specific dates print('\nüìÖ TIMELINE ANALYSIS - SUBMISSION DATES:') print('-' * 55) months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'june', 'july', 'august', 'september', 'october', 'november', 'december'] years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023'] for timeline_item in research_data['timeline_evidence'][:10]: timeline_text = timeline_item['timeline_text'].lower() # Check for specific month/year combinations found_dates = [] for month in months: for year in years: if month in timeline_text and year in timeline_text: found_dates.append(f"{month.title()} {year}") if found_dates: print(f'\nüìç DATE EVIDENCE: {", ".join(set(found_dates))}') print(f' SOURCE: {timeline_item["source"]}') print(f' CONTENT: {timeline_text[:300]}...') # Energy technology analysis if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('\n‚ö° ENERGY HARVESTING TECHNOLOGY FINDINGS:') print('-' * 55) for airport in ['gatwick', 'luton']: energy_findings = research_data['airport_findings'][airport]['energy_tech'] if energy_findings: print(f'\nüõ´ {airport.upper()} AIRPORT ENERGY TECHNOLOGY:') for finding in energy_findings: print(f' ‚Ä¢ SOURCE: {finding["source"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ EVIDENCE: {finding["evidence"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ URL: {finding["url"]}') # Planning Inspectorate official records if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('\nüèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS:') print('-' * 55) for record in research_data['planning_inspectorate_records'][:5]: print(f'\nüìã OFFICIAL RECORD:') print(f' TITLE: {record["title"]}') print(f' URL: {record["url"]}') print(f' PREVIEW: {record["content_preview"]}...') else: print('‚ùå No search results collected') # Save comprehensive research data results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'airport_expansion_dco_research_working.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 90) print('GATWICK & LUTON AIRPORT DCO EXPANSION RESEARCH - WORKING VERSION COMPLETE') print('=' * 90) if research_data['search_results']: print('‚úÖ RESEARCH SUCCESSFUL - Evidence collected and processed') print('\nüìä FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Search queries: {len(research_data["search_queries"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Relevant results: {len(all_relevant_results)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Evidence types: {len(set(all_evidence_indicators))}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Timeline references: {len(research_data["timeline_evidence"])}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Official records: {len(research_data["planning_inspectorate_records"])}') if research_data['timeline_evidence']: print('\nüéØ KEY TIMELINE EVIDENCE COLLECTED - Ready for date analysis') if research_data['airport_findings']['gatwick']['energy_tech'] or research_data['airport_findings']['luton']['energy_tech']: print('‚ö° ENERGY TECHNOLOGY EVIDENCE FOUND - Ready for correlation analysis') if research_data['planning_inspectorate_records']: print('üèõÔ∏è OFFICIAL PLANNING INSPECTORATE RECORDS IDENTIFIED') else: print('‚ùå LIMITED SUCCESS - Alternative search strategies needed') print('\n=== WORKING VERSION COMPLETE - DATA READY FOR ANALYSIS ===')
